content:
Hey, I'm trying to replicate the default blog view from Drupal 7 in Backdrop - i think I'm missing something in the contextual filter setup - HALP!
For example {site}/blogs/basketball would give you a view of all blog posts by user name basketball. This is how it works in the Drupal 7 site out of the box.
blog-contextual-filter.jpeg
blog-path.jpeg
Did you add a relationship to the author?

Laryn said:

Did you add a relationship to the author?

Yes. That was there. I got it working through a lot of trial and error. part of the problem was the path. I'm now struggling with where the No Results text can go. I'll post everything when I'm done in here and when I get time, where should I write a post on how to do this. I'm sure I'm not the only one who will want to and the instructions really don't cover this. Taxonomy views were a piece of cake comparatively. I've done other URL path stuff before, but I always used Better Exposed Filters.

One of your friendly site admins will then publish the post :wink:
